title: What were The Beatles' musical influences? - Quora

response.answer_text: Buddy Holly (The Beatles’ greatest musical influence / inspiration was undoubtedly Buddy Holly as they were infact named initially as the “Silver Beetles” rather than adopting the now iconic band name we know them as “The Beatles” after Holly’s backup rock and roll band, The Crickets. Both John Lennon & Paul McCartney admired / studied and have named Holly, his performance style & especially his songwriting skills as the biggest influence on them that affected them greatly / deeply to pick up instruments and form a band).Little Richard (in Paul McCartney’s case, who admired Richard’s vocal skills & especially his screaming style while performing on his songs).Elvis Presley (in both John Lennon’s & George Harrison’s case, as Lennon long before even forming his band, The Quarrymen & long before evolving the Quarrymen into the classic line-up of The Beatles in 1960, he (Lennon) recalled that once he heard “Heartbreak Hotel” by Elvis Presley, later on saw Presley’s attractive looking photos, saw him (Presley) perform live & suddenly saw how the crowd (mostly young teenage girls) reacted as they screamed on top of their lungs for Presley came to realize that he himself (Lennon) could also get the crowd & ladies to react in same hysterical wild screams in a manner that Presley did (as in future Lennon’s band The Beatles’ own female hysteria “Beatlemania” is known widely more than Presley phenomenon) & suddenly that “screaming” factor was the primary reason of Lennon forming and starting a band / musical group with a bunch of his school friends whereas in Harrison’s case the EXACT SAME song “Heartbreak Hotel” by Elvis Presley was the record that influenced the then 16 year old George Harrison to audition for Lennon’s Quarrymen band via on the request of Harrison’s own school friend, McCartney).Chuck Berry.Bob Dylan (in all of the Beatles (John, Paul, George & Ringo’s cases) musical style solo or when they were together for a short time recording career).Ravi Shankar (in ONLY George Harrison’s case, who later on became an ardent devotee & great admirer of eastern Indian culture & music especially, asked Pandit Shankar to teach himself (Harrison) a sitar (Indian classical music instrument) & then after learning it went on to play the sitar successfully in the Beatles’ 1966 Rubber Soul album on the “Norwegian Bird (It Has Flown)” track, Interestingly George was the one & ONLY Beatle himself who encouraged all the other Beatles’ (John, Paul, & Ringo) to travel to India for peace, meditation, yoga, etc……… via the followings & teachings of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, a Hindu spiritual leader).The Everly Brothers.

The Beatles’ seminal musical influences include: Elvis PresleyCarl Perkins—George copied his licksLittle Richard—Paul copied his vocal styleChuck BerryBuddy HollyEddy CochranRoy OrbisonThe Everly Brothers—John and Paul copied their vocal harmoniesBob Dylan—Dylan inspired John and Paul to write deeper, more meaningful lyricsThe Who—Paul tried to out-do their hard-rock guitar in “Helter Skelter”Brian Wilson—his “Pet Sounds” was a major influence on the BeatlesRavi Shankar--he taught George the sitarFats Domino—Paul copied his piano styleBilly Preston—the only person to ever receive equal billing with the Beatles: “Get Back—the Beatles featuring Billy Preston”Eric Clapton—influenced GeorgeGeorge Martin—taught the Beatles the importance of arrangement, taught them that he studio was the most important musical tool, encouraged their experimental efforts, and played keyboard on nearly every Beatles album.Lonnie Donegan—The Quarry Men was a skiffle bandMeredith Willson—Paul was enamored with the American musical “The Music Man” and he sang “Till There Was You” on Ed SullivanLieber and Stoller—influenced John and Paul’s songwritingGoffen and King—influenced John and Paul’s songwritingHoagy Carmichael —George loved him and covered some of his tunes
